resources.string: You Have No Trainings Saved. Do You Want To Add Your Routines First (Recommended)?

Here, You Can Log Your Training History.

Simply:

1)Choose A Date,

2)Select The Training You Want To Input... If You Have No Trainings Saved,You Will Be Asked To Input Some. You Do Not Have To Follow This Step, You Can Also Add Freestyle Trainings (Trainings Without A Name, Just A Description And Difficulty). However, If You Do A Training Regularly, We Recommend Adding It First (See Trainings)

3)If You Rested, Click The Green Button. If You Rested When You Should Not Have, Click The Red Button.

4)Click The Add Button!
Once You Add A Training, It Will Be Displayed On The Calendar, With One Of These Icons, Based On Its Difficulty

Here You Can Log Your Weight For The Day.

Simply:

1)Chose A Date

2)Enter Your Weight For The Selected Date

3)You Are Done!
The App Will Do The Rest For You, And Make All The Calculations Neccessary For You To Know If You Are On The Right Path To Your Weight Goals

Once You Add A Weight Entry, It Will Be Displayed On The Calendar, With One Of These Icons, Based On Its Weather Your Weight Changes Are Good Or Bad.\n\nOptimal Weight Maintenance Is Considered Anything Withing 0.5 KG If Your Ideal Weight.

Our Community Is Where You Can Download Trainings From Other Users!

Simply Enter The Community Page, And You Can Start Browsing Right Away.

Feel Free To Search Trainings By Name Or Difficulty.

You Can Share Your Own Trainings With The FitTracker Community, From Your Trainings Page!
Note: You Can Not Download A Training By A Name, That You Already Used In Your Own Trainings! If You Try To Do So, The App Will Ask You To Select A New Name For The Downloaded Training!

To Download A Training,
Simply:

1)Select The Training You Want To Download

2)Press This Button:

The Training Page Is Where You Can Add, Browse, Edit And Delete All Of Trainings, From One Place.

All Trainings Must Have 3 Things:
1)A Name (The Name Must Be Unique)

2)A Description: This Is Where You Should Enter Exactly What You Did In That Training. In Case You Are Planning To Share This Training With The FitTracker Community, We Recommend Being s Descriptive As Possible (Search UPPER1 OR LEGS1 For An Example Of A Perfectly Described Training)

3)A Difficulty: To Categorise Trainings, We Have 3 Difficulties, Represented By 3 Colors:
